item.title: provision settlement fal0002ee
item.description: Remember: Companies recognize a provision (liability) when an obligation to perform future services or payments arises. Although the amount or the timing of the obligation are not certain, provisions are recognized in the balance sheet as liabilities if the obligation is likely to occur and the liability amount can be estimated reliably (usually based on historical data or past experience). When provisions are settled, the liability decreases. Provisions can be classified as both short-term liabilities or long-term liabilities.

item.title: provisions fal0001bu

Although the amount or the timing of the obligation are not certain, provisions are recognized in the balance sheet as liabilities if the obligation is likely to occur and the liability amount can be estimated reliably (usually based on historical data or past experience). Contingent liabilities are reported with an amount in the notes to the financial statements but they are not recognized as liabilities in the balance sheet because there is too much uncertainty as to whether there will be an obligation, when will the obligation happen or the amount of the obligation.
